heading: TARGETED MUSCLES: Thighs. WHAT YOU NEED: Sturdy chair. TIP: As you progress, you may want to add ankle weights. This exercise strengthens your thighs and may reduce symptoms of arthritis of the knee.

steps.1: Sit in a sturdy chair with your back supported by the chair. Only the balls of your feet and your toes should rest on the floor. Put a rolled bath towel at the edge of the chair under thighs for support. Breathe in slowly.
steps.2: Breathe out and slowly extend one leg in front of you as straight as possible, but don't lock your knee.
steps.3: Flex foot to point toes toward the ceiling. Hold position for 1 second.
steps.4: Breathe in as you slowly lower leg back down.
steps.7: Repeat 10-15 more times with each leg.
